nodes.bodyText: I think it'd be neater for the caller to construct this PersistedState (no need for it to be a LucenePersistedState either, and it already carries the current term and last-accepted state).
Could this executor have a bounded queue? AFAICT there'll only be ≤1 task.
I think this is unexpected unless we're shutting down, so maybe better to assert threadPoolExecutor.isShutdown().
👍 Slightly subtle given that we're already under the Coordinator's mutex here, but we aren't in the scheduled updater thread so it's important to be under our own mutex too.

I see some slightly questionable synchronisation here. We construct the PersistedClusterStateService.Writer using a simple ArrayList of MetaDataIndexWriters, and then iterate through that when closing it on (potentially) a different thread. Unrelated to this PR, I just noticed it.
I have a follow-up PR that addresses this and other issues related to the PersistedClusterStateService.Writer lifecycle.
